Title: Graph Paths II
Description: Consider a directed weighted graph having n nodes and m edges. Your task is to calculate the minimum path length from node 1 to node n with exactly k edges.
Input Specification:
The first input line contains three integers n, m and k: the number of nodes and edges, and the length of the path. The nodes are numbered 1,2,\dots,n. 
 Then, there are m lines describing the edges. Each line contains three integers a, b and c: there is an edge from node a to node b with weight c.
Output Specification: Print the minimum path length. If there are no such paths, print -1.
Constraints:
1 \le n \le 100
1 \le m \le n(n-1)
1 \le k \le 10^9
1 \le a,b \le n
1 \le c \le 10^9
